posts.name:
Indian Startup News
Indian Startup News
posts.content:
Satya Nadella-led Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion or over Rs 25,000 crore in India in cloud and AI infrastructure and skilling over the next two years, including the establishment of new data centres.

The investment aims to accelerate AI innovation in India, which is pivotal for achieving Honâ€™ble Prime Minister Narendra Modiâ€™s vision of becoming a developed nation (Viksit Bharat) by 2047.

It will also support the countryâ€™s long-term competitiveness by training 10 million people over the next five years with AI skills, as part of the second edition of its ADVANTA(I)GE India program.

Read the full story here:ğŸ‘‡

comments.commentText:
nextlyAI is a unified platform for a scholarship, college, study abroad mentorship, college directory.

Take your career to next level with our AI-powered platform For mentorship,tutoring, scholarship and college everything you need in one place.

What nextlyAI offers
nextlyAI helps students with finding personalised career guidance, mentorship, scholarship and tutor matching for succes.

Follow us on linkedin

Indian Startup News It's essential to distinguish between future plans and current realities. Statements like "Microsoft will invest" refer to future intentions, not present actions. As of now, Microsoft has announced plans to invest $3 billion over the next two years to enhance its cloud and AI infrastructure in India.

While this commitment is promising, it's crucial to focus on the tangible benefits that existing cloud AI capabilities offer today. Microsoft's current AI infrastructure is already being utilized to enhance public services, improve healthcare delivery, and support educational initiatives.

Blindly applauding announcements of future investments without understanding their current impact reflects a desire for immediate gratification, akin to expecting instant deliveries. Instead, let's engage thoughtfully with the present capabilities and consider how they can be leveraged for societal benefit. This approach fosters a more informed and proactive community, ready to utilize technology effectively rather than passively awaiting future developments.

In summary, while future investments are encouraging, it's the present applications of cloud AI that hold immediate potential for societal welfare. Let's focus on that
Bharath Kumar Kunjibettu ğŸ’

posts.name:
Pratyay Banerjee
Pratyay Banerjee
posts.content: TaskUs TaskUs (formerly heloo powered by TaskUs) Indoor has laid off more than 300 employees, leaving hundreds of families in distress. This decision highlights a disturbing trend where profits are prioritized over people. Employees are the backbone of any organization, and treating them as expendable undermines their immense contribution to a companyâ€™s success. Did the management consider the families who depend on these employees? In a country like India, where social security is minimal, such actions leave people vulnerable, with no safety net to fall back on. The government must step in immediately to address this issue and hold companies accountable for the well-being of their workforce. Organizations must realize that their true strength lies in their employees, not just in profits. It's time to put people first.

posts.name:
Dr. Manan Vora
Dr. Manan Vora
posts.content:
If you ended 2024 with unclaimed office leaves, youâ€™re endangering your mental health.

See, there are 2 kinds of employees.

1. Those who take advantage of every leave in their HR policy (this is 90% of people).

2. Those who think theyâ€™ll impress their boss and take as few leaves as possible.

If youâ€™re in the 2nd category, Iâ€™m here to tell you that youâ€™re doing it all wrong.

Firstly, most Indian companies give the bare minimum leave allowance - the least you need for your mental health.

And skipping even those leaves doesnâ€™t make you a better employee. It makes you a more exhausted one.

As a doctor, Iâ€™ve seen how chronic stress manifests in patients:

- Insomnia
- Fatigue
- Burnout

The human body isnâ€™t designed for constant output.

And mental reset grants you superpowers like:

- 40% more creativity
- A stronger immune system
- Higher emotional resilience
- And a higher life expectancy

So please, donâ€™t make the same mistake in 2025.

Block those leaves. Plan a trip. Or just stay home and sleep in.

Because when you take care of yourself, youâ€™re not â€˜slacking offâ€™ â€” youâ€™re investing in your long-term health, happiness, AND productivity.

So itâ€™s good for your mind, body and career.

Found this impactful? Repost to help your connections too.

posts.name:
The Corporate Bhakt â„¢ï¸
The Corporate Bhakt â„¢ï¸
posts.content:
Radhika Gupta, Edelweiss clarified that while hard work is non-negotiable for success, it must be sustainable. â€œHard work is not equal to hours worked. Many of those hours in entry-level careers were pure facetime. Hard work needs to be sustainable for us to do it long enough for compounding to kick in.â€

She criticized inefficiencies in workplace culture that reward appearances over output. â€œMany developed nations work 8â€“4 but ensure those hours are productive. Come in on time, bring your best, and use technology to be effective,â€ she wrote, citing her teamâ€™s use of AI to reduce grunt work.

via

comments.commentText:
Maximum productive working hours is around 8 Hrs. Sitting in the office more than 8 hours is waste, work efficiency will be very very low, in case of emergency we can work extra hours but not regularly.

If we stop doing personal errands in the office we will have enough time to do our normal work.

Regularly working long hours will have profound effect on one's health and family life.

We need to have some spare time to think about other things apart from work related. Our professional advancements and meeting personal commitments is in our own hands no body else will help.

If employees have to work long hours regularly, means the company need to employ more people.

posts.name:
Konstantin Simonchik
Konstantin Simonchik
posts.content:
Neither the document nor the background in this image are real! This is a fully AI-generated ID document with astonishing quality - even down to details like the smartphoneâ€™s shadow on the passport and the table.

Emerging services on the Dark Web are creating alarming opportunities for fraudsters. These tools donâ€™t just generate one deepfake image - they produce multiple ones from a simple list of PII, paving the way for synthetic fraud on an unprecedented scale.

Itâ€™s crucial for modern KYC services and assessment procedures to adapt and account for these advancements in fraud technology. Staying ahead requires constant vigilance and innovation.

comments.commentText: The advent of AI's capability to generate fraudulent documents on demand has significantly heightened the risk of fraud. This situation underscores the urgent need for the establishment of reliable, government-operated open validation services. These services should extend beyond just local, state, and federal government agencies to include educational institutions, medium to large corporations, and certification bodies. To combat this growing threat effectively, such validation services ought to be regulated and provided as a mandatory, free service to ensure widespread accessibility and security.

comments.commentText:
I respectfully disagree that AI only accelerates output and not outcomes. When used strategically, AI is already a productivity enhancer and a gamechanger.
I would argue that the limitation is us - not technology. We must consider our processes and the state of the art - both present and as a moving target - to drive optimum business value and outcomes.
it accelerates output for sure but not *always* outcomes.
Amen to that.

It's easy to have any idea and then punch it into AI, but I think the challenge lies in resisting the temptation to treat AI output as a finished product. Editing, correcting and adding personalization to the content is crucial not only to ensure accuracy but also to align the tone, purpose, and depth of the work with our objectives. The real value of AI emerges when it acts as a catalyst for higher-level thinking, enabling us to focus on what truly mattersâ€”insight, strategy, and creativity. We as humans need to read and discern.
